translation: rozgrzeszać, przebaczać [formal; (especially in religion or law) to free someone from guilt, blame, or responsibility for something]
sentence: I absolve you from all your sins.
Each circle represents the location of fox den site.
He made some derogatory remark about her appearance.

translation: spustoszenie, pustka [the state of a place that is empty or where everything has been destroyed]
sentence: It was difficult to describe the emptiness, the desolation of the area.

translation: musujący (lub: tryskający życiem) [(of a liquid) having or producing small bubbles of gas; (of people and their behavior) excited, enthusiastic, and full of energy]
sentence: Mineral water may be effervescent due to contained gases.
This wine has a delicious fruity flavour.

translation: ciekawy, ciekawski [wanting to discover as much as you can about things, sometimes in a way that annoys people]
sentence: She could see inquisitive faces looking out from the windows next door.

translation: zatrzask, zasuwka [a small piece of metal on a door that you move down so that the door will stay closed]
sentence: He lifted the latch and opened the door.
Mastication is the action of chewing food.

translation: pracować, robić swoje [to sell or to work regularly at something, especially at a job that involves selling things]
sentence: Fishermen in small boats ply their trade up and down the coast.

translation: pamięć [formal; the act of remembering and showing respect for someone who has died or a past event]
sentence: A church service was held in remembrance of the victims.

translation: rożen, szpikulec [a long, thin, metal stick put through a piece of food, especially meat, so that it can be cooked above a fire]
sentence: Roast the lamb on a spit.
He was in the throes of despair after losing his job.

translation: niejasny, nieokreślony [not clearly expressed, known, described, or decided]
sentence: I do have a vague memory of meeting her many years ago.
She made a veiled reference to his past mistakes.
